bug.short_desc: New version of libmetalink is out - 0.1.3

long_desc.thetext:
This release has a fix for a bug in parsing PGP signatures.
There is a github: https://github.com/metalink-dev/libmetalink/commits/release-0.1.3
and a launchpad: https://launchpad.net/libmetalink/trunk/libmetalink-0.1.3
Not sure which one is official these days.
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 25 development cycle. Changing version to '25'.
libmetalink-0.1.3-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-d91c6819c7
libmetalink-0.1.3-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-5fc950c1d4
libmetalink-0.1.3-1.el6 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 6. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2016-c91eb5193d
libmetalink-0.1.3-1.el7 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2016-48032dfc43

libmetalink-0.1.3-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-d91c6819c7
